intro: Medinilla matitanensis, commonly known as the "Hawaiian hibiscus," is a flowering plant native to the island of Oahu in Hawaii. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with glossy, dark green leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
